treatments_requested.name: H.P. Acthar Gel
treatments_requested.other_or_notes: FDA approved for treatment of multiple sclerosis exacerbations

treatments_tried_but_failed.name: Solu-Medrol
treatments_tried_but_failed.other_or_notes: Standard of care but caused significant side effects

treatments_tried_and_worked.name: H.P. Acthar Gel
treatments_tried_and_worked.other_or_notes: Better response and fewer side effects compared to Solu-Medrol

guidelines_details: Acthar gel is FDA approved for treatment of multiple sclerosis exacerbations and is an option for patients with no intravenous access or poor response to Solu-Medrol.
soc_details: Acthar gel is an option for patients with no intravenous access, poor response to intravenous Solu-Medrol, and significant tolerability issues with Solu-Medrol.
rationale: Given the patient's documented intolerance to intravenous steroids and the documented response to Acthar Gel previously, Acthar gel is medically necessary.
